eu.greenlightning.hypercubepdf

Class HCPArea

  • java.lang.Object
    • eu.greenlightning.hypercubepdf.HCPArea
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    HCPElement

    public class HCPArea
extends Object
implements HCPElement
    A filled area with a border. Both the filling of the background and the drawing of the border are optional operations and a separate color can be configured for each one.

    Furthermore, which parts of the border are drawn can be configured using HCPAreaBorder. However, the width of the border is currently fixed to be 1 default use space unit. Also note that the border is drawn exactly on the edges of the PDRectangle supplied to the paint(PDPageContentStream, PDRectangle) method, meaning half a unit of the border will be outside the boundary and the other half will be inside the boundary. This also means that if two HCPAreas are drawn side by side their borders will completely overlap.

    The getWidth() and getHeight() methods will make the background 1 unit big in each direction, accounting for the insets of the border if it is drawn.

    This class is immutable.

    See Also:
    Default User Space

      Constructors

    • Constructor Detail

      • HCPArea

        public HCPArea(Color contentColor)
        Creates an HCPArea with no border.

        If contentColor is null the background will not be filled.

        Note that the element will be invisible if contentColor is null, because the border is not drawn either.

        Parameters:
        contentColor - the color to use for filling the background or null

      • HCPArea

        public HCPArea(Color contentColor,
               Color borderColor)
        Creates an HCPArea with full border.

        If contentColor is null the background will not be filled. If borderColor is null the border will not be drawn.

        Note that the element will be invisible if both contentColor and borderColor are null.

        Parameters:
        contentColor - the color to use for filling the background or null
        borderColor - the color to use for drawing the border or null

      • HCPArea

        public HCPArea(Color contentColor,
               Color borderColor,
               HCPAreaBorder border)
        Creates an HCPArea with the given border.

        If contentColor is null the background will not be filled.

        Note that for the border to be drawn, borderColor must not be null and border must not be HCPAreaBorder.NO_BORDER.

        Note that the element will be invisible if contentColor is null and the border is not drawn.

        Parameters:
        contentColor - the color to use for filling the background or null
        borderColor - the color used for drawing the border or null
        border - the border type to use; not null
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if border is null
        See Also:
        HCPAreaBorder

      • paint

        public void paint(PDPageContentStream content,
                  PDRectangle shape)
           throws IOException
        Description copied from interface: HCPElement
        Paints this element to the specified PDPageContentStream.

        Shape defines the position and size which should be used for painting. If the size is less than specified by HCPElement.getWidth() and HCPElement.getHeight() then this method does not guarantee that (a) the requested size is used or (b) the element is painted correctly or (c) the element is painted at all.

        Specified by:
        paint in interface HCPElement
        Parameters:
        content - not null
        shape - not null
        Throws:
        IOException - if there is an error writing to the stream
